__TOC__



This week's Hug Day will focus on ''' network-manager-applet '''! 

After you have triaged or fixed a bug put your name in the last column and set the row's background to green by adding '''lightgreen''' in the first cell of the column after '''rowbgcolor='''.  This will let people know that the bug in that row has been hugged.

=== Tools ===

For doing your work easier during the hug days remember to use the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuBugDay/Tools|hugday-tools]]</nowiki>.

=== 5-a-day-ing ===
During hug days you can also do <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/5-A-Day|5-A-Day]]</nowiki> for this one you can do the following in order to tag your work on the hug day:

* 5-a-day --add-tag hugday-'''20090219'''
* Add bugs to 5-a-day as usual
* And when done with hug day run: 5-a-day --remove-tag hugday-'''20090219'''

=== Stock Responses ===

For problem specific Stock Responses see: <nowiki>[[Bugs-Responses]]</nowiki>

=== 8 Bugs with attachments flagged as patches ===
'''To mark it off the list you should:'''

The following bug reports have attachments that have been indicated to be patches.  Please review them to see whether or not they are in fact patches, for guidance see the <nowiki>[[ Bugs-Patches | patch workflow ]]</nowiki>.

* Review the patch attachment to see whether it really is a patch
* Move the bug along the triaging process by setting it to Confirmed or Triaged
* If the patch is in the form of a debdiff subscribe the main-sponsors team to the bug report
